oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Avenge Pearl Harbor, Nashville, Tennessee 1942 June
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A scene from the parade and ceremony for “Avenge Pearl Harbor,” when more than 100 ‘Pearl Harbor Avengers’ swore an oath of Naval allegiance in front of the War Memorial Building in Nashville, Tennessee, on Sunday, June 7th, 1942. This event was part of a national enlistment campaign commemorating the six-month anniversary of Pearl Harbor. According to the Nashville Banner, 195 enlistees took the oath in Tennessee following parades and ceremonies held at 12 cities throughout the state. On Sunday evening, part of the “Avengers” embarked via train at Union Station, with another contingent departing on Monday June 8th. Source: Nashville Banner newspaper. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
